author:
Jon Wilner

jwilner@mercurynews.com
title: Matchup: No. 18 Stanford vs. Arizona
text:
NO. 18 STANFORD VS. ARIZONA RECORDS: Stanford 3-1, 2-0 Pac-12. Arizona 3-1, 0-1. 
KICKOFF: 7:30 p.m. at Stanford Stadium 
TV/RADIO: Pac-12 Networks/1050-AM 
SERIES HISTORY: Tied 14-14, but Stanford has won three in a row. The teams haven't met since 2012. 
STORYLINES: Stanford takes aim at its fourth consecutive win as it begins a stretch of three in a row at home. ... The Cardinal has topped the 40-point mark in back-to-back games, a feat not accomplished since early in the 2013 season. Arizona's defense just yielded 56 points to UCLA. ... Stanford's inexperienced defense faces the Pac-12's most potent offense: Arizona leads the conference in scoring, total offense and rushing, but quarterback Anu Solomon is questionable (concussion). The other options are senior Jerrard Randall and freshman Brandon Dawkins. ... Arizona is 5-1 in its past six road games. Road teams are undefeated thus far in Pac-12 play. ... Stanford quarterback Kevin Hogan was limited in practice (ankle) but will play. ... The Cardinal is favored by 13ï»¿1/2 points. 
INJURY UPDATE: Stanford -- LB Noor Davis (leg), DT Harrison Phillips (knee), DL Nate Lohn (undisclosed) and LB Kevin Anderson (undisclosed) are out. DL Aziz Shittu (undisclosed) and Brennan Scarlett (undisclosed) are probable. Arizona -- LB Scooby Wright (foot) and WR Trey Griffey (foot) are out. Solomon (concussion) and LB Derrick Turituri (hip) are questionable. 
MATCHUP TO WATCH: Stanford's offensive line against Arizona's defensive front. The Cardinal quintet is responsible for a re-energized running game that has powered for 520 yards the past two games. Stanford's line averages 301 pounds per man. Arizona's defensive front averages 271 pounds per player. The Wildcats use a 3-3-5 defensive formation, but two safeties (the Spur and Bandit positions) are available to provide run support. Advertisement 
STATS THAT MATTER: Stanford has averaged 42.8 points in its past four games against Arizona. ... Stanford tailback Christian McCaffrey leads the Pac-12 in all-purpose yards (222.2 per game). ... Arizona tailback Nick Wilson leads the conference in rushing (142.5 yards per game). ... Stanford is last in the league in sacks and turnovers forced. ... Hogan is 27-9 as a starter, tied for first among active starters nationally. -- JON WILNER
